body_text.text: Meanwhile, more than 330 medical teams, comprising 41600 medical staff from 29 provinces, including 57 military health personnel, were temporarily assigned to Hubei Province to contribute to the treatment of 58

(2) Classification. Classification is employed to divide the outbreak areas and their associated risk 61 factors into different levels, which consider the number of confirmed cases and the factors closely related to 62 disease transmission, including population characteristics and the living environment. After the 63 confirmation of Human-to-human transmission [9], in response to the proliferation of the epidemic, 64 differential prevention and control measures were adopted informed by a risk level detailed at the county 65 scale. The central government, from Jan 23rd 2020, implemented a "closed management" policy in Wuhan 66 [10] and six other cities in Hubei Province through closure of train stations, airports and highways that 67 strictly controlled population mobility. Localities in cities that would typically have been crowded were 68 closed to prevent asymptomatic patients from transmitting the virus. On Feb 25th 2020, to ensure an 69 orderly return to work after the Spring Festival holiday during the containing COVID-19 process, the 70

Chinese government issued a document stating that all provinces (except Hubei and Beijing) should declare 71 the epidemic risk level for their counties based on the number of confirmed cases, evaluated as "low", 72 "medium" and "high" risk levels (http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-02/18/content_5480514.htm).

Through the coordination, classification, and collaboration (3C) systematic approach, China has been 86 able to curb the spread of the COVID-19 nationally. It is notable that these three processes are not 87 independent but interrelated. For example, classification requires collaboration between different 88 government agencies at different administrative levels, which in turn helps to strengthen management 89

coordination. In addition, effective implementation of policies is inseparable from collaboration between 90 different departments. Moreover, spontaneous collaboration behaviors among the general public 91

(bottom-up) requires appropriate guidance from the government (top-down). In order to deal with the huge 92 challenges of human-environmental systems, the systematic approach needs to fully consider the 93 interaction between different agencies and actors. is essential to defeating the epidemic. As such, governments have the responsibility and obligation to take 110 measures that foster the willingness of the broader population to collaborate. It is also very important to 111 publish accurate information about infection status in a timely manner and to actively seek collaboration 112 with the international community.

Currently, more than 100 countries/territories/areas across six continents have been affected by the 114 novel coronavirus and the challenge to control its further spread is clearly now a global one. The 3C 115 approach tells us that whether the fight against COVID-19 can be won depends not only on drugs and 116

doctors, but also on the joint participation and efforts of all society members. Therefore, all countries need 117 to nurture trust, and collaboration must be as comprehensive as possible; this requires not only the sharing 118 of effective management and treatment methods, but also critical medicines and other materials. Overall, 119

there is a need for all countries to take joint actions, actively contribute their own efforts and share their 120 experiences, successful or otherwise. Such efforts can contribute to ensuring healthy lives and the 121 promotion of wellbeing for people of all ages.

In the 15 early phases of the outbreak in Wuhan City, timely and effective control measures to prevent COVID-19 16 spread were delayed for several reasons, including lack of knowledge and vigilance regarding the new 17 disease, insufficient or inefficient detection tools. However, the adoption by Chinese authorities of a 18 systematic approach to the disease has resulted in the number of recoveries per day, since Feb 18th, 2020, http://cpc.people.com.cn/n1/2020/0223/c64094-31600380.html). For example, to improve the 53 recovery rate and reduce mortality in Hubei Province, the central government immediately coordinated a 54 number of different agencies, and quickly operationalized several specialized treatment hospitals within a 55 very short period, including the construction of completely new Huoshenshan and Leishenshan hospitals. 56
